page.title: 19Sports day in Norham
page.content: Preparation for the Childrens Sports day in Norham starts many nights before the "1st Saturday in July" with the planning and making of a crepe paper fancy dress. The big day arrives, children assemble on the "green" in their finery to be judged. Half an hour later they're back to t-shirts and shorts ready for the races. Running is the easiest but sack races, egg and spoon (using potatoes), obstacle, 3-legged and a Mums and Dads race are also included in the agenda. Small cash prizes attracts participants. After this everyone goes off to the hall for tea, provided by the sports committee and the Mums of competitors. Then it's all home to change for the evening disco whilst Dads prefer to stay on the green and compete in a knock out Quoits competition.
